questions.question: A 25-year-old woman presents with malodorous vaginal discharge and dysuria. Theexamination finding is shown below. What is the drug of choice for this condition?
questions.explanation: The given scenario and image showing strawberry vagina and cervix are suggestive oftrichomoniasis. The drug of choice is metronidazole. It is given as a single dose of 2g.Both metronidazole and tinidazole are effective in the management of trichomonas vaginitis.Tinidazole has been reported to have fewer GI-related side effects and less resistance compared tometronidazole. However, it is much more expensive and is preferred in cases refractory tometronidazole.

questions.question: Metronidazole is selectively active against anaerobic and microaerophilic organisms because:

options.A: Aerobes have oxygen gradient inside the cell which deactivates metronidazole moiety
options.B: Only anaerobes and microaerophilic organisms reduce it to generate reactive nitro radicals
options.C: Aerobes have efflux drug pumping mechanism for metronidazole
options.D: Metronidazole inserts pore in the cell membrane of anaerobes and microaerophilic bacteria

questions.explanation: Metronidazole is selectively active against anaerobic and microaerophilic organisms because onlythese organisms reduce it to generate reactive nitro radicals.They contain electron transport components that donate an electron to metronidazole. Thisresults in the formation of a highly reactive nitro radical anion that targets DNA and kills theorganism.

questions.question: 523A child presents with diarrhea, weight loss, and abdominal pain. His mother reports stools tobegreasy and foul-smelling. A wet preparation of the stool sample is shown below. What isfirst-line therapy for this condition?
questions.explanation: The clinical scenario and the presence of cysts of Giardia lamblia in stool point towards adiagnosis of giardiasis, and tinidazole is the treatment of choice for this condition.Both metronidazole and tinidazole are considered first-line drugs however, tinidazole isconsidered superior in its efficacy in comparison to metronidazole.Drug dosage:•Metronidazole: 250- 500mg TID orally for 7 days•Tinidazole: 2g single dose orallyThe cyst of Giardia is small and oval, and is surrounded by a hyaline cyst wall. Its internalstructure includes two pairs of nuclei grouped at one end. A young cyst contains one pair ofnuclei. The axostyle lies diagonally, forming a dividing line within the cyst wall.

questions.question: Metronidazole is least likely to be effective in the treatment of:
questions.explanation: Metronidazole is not effective in the management of pneumocystosis caused by Pneumocystisjirovecii. Co-trimoxazole is used in the management of this condition.Metronidazole is used in the following conditions:• Giardiasis• Trichomoniasis• Amoebiasis535• Bacterial vaginosis• Anaerobic infections - bacteroides and clostridium.•• Pseudomembranous colitis (alternative to vancomycin & fidaxomicin)

questions.question: A 6-year-old boy presents with lower abdominal pain and diarrhea. The stool examinationfinding is shown below. Which of the following drugs cannot be used for the eradication ofintestinal cysts in this condition?524
questions.explanation: The image shows hematophagous trophozoite of Entamoeba histolytica and metronidazole is notan effective agent against cysts of amoeba in the colon.Metronidazole is used in the treatment of amoebiasis (amoebic colitis, amoebic liver abscess). It iswell absorbed from the small intestine and only a small amount of the unabsorbed drug reachesthe colon, which is insufficient to kill the cysts.Hence, luminal agents like diloxanide furoate, nitazoxanide or iodoquinol are required for theeradication of cysts and trophozoites in the intestine.

questions.question: Which of the following is used in the treatment of a patient with asymptomatic intestinalamoebiasis?
questions.explanation: The drug of choice for the treatment of asymptomatic intestinal luminal amoebiasis due to E.histolytica is paromomycin.Paromomycin (aminosidine) is an aminoglycoside that has poor oral absorption and hence it actsonly in the intestinal lumen as a luminal amebicide. It has no effect against extraintestinalorganisms.

questions.question: A 21-year-old male presented to the OPD complaining of blood-streaked stools.Sigmoidoscopy was done and it showed ulcers in the sigmoid. Biopsy was taken from thisarea and the histopathological image is given below. Which of the following is the mostappropriate treatment?525
questions.explanation: The given clinical picture and the histopathological image showing flask-shaped ulcers aresuggestive of intestinal amoebiasis. The most appropriate treatment is intravenous metronidazole.The amoebic ulcer which is flask-shaped is the typical lesion seen in intestinal amoebiasis. Theulcers are multiple and are confined to the colon. Sometimes, in secondary intestinal lesions, theulcers are numerous in the cecum, followed by the sigmoido-rectal region.Three classes of drugs are used in the treatment of amebiasis:•• Luminal amoebicides- diloxanide furoate, iodoquinol, paromomycin, and tetracycline. They actin the intestinal lumen but not in tissues.• Tissue amoebicides- emetine and chloroquine. They are effective in systemic infection but lesseffective in the intestine.• Both luminal and tissue amebicides- Metronidazole, tinidazole and imidazole. They act on bothsites and are the drug of choice for treating amebic colitis and amebic liver abscess.536

questions.question: A patient presents with sudden onset fever with chills and malaise. On examinationsplenomegaly was present. Bone marrow picture is shown in the image. Which of thefollowing drugs is not used in the treatment of this condition?(B)
questions.explanation: The given scenario and the bone marrow picture showing macrophages infected with intracellularLeishman-Donovan bodies point towards a diagnosis of visceralleishmaniasis. Hydroxychloroquine is not indicated in the treatment of this condition.The drugs effective in visceral leishmaniasis are:• Liposomal amphotericin B (preferred)• Sodium stibogluconate (not in India)• Miltefosine•Paromomycin•Pentamidine (rarely used)Hydroxychloroquine is an antimalarial agent and is also used in the treatment of dermatologicalconditions like:•Cutaneous lupus erythematosus•Cutaneous dermatomyositis• Polymorphous light eruption• Porphyria cutanea tarda• Sarcoidosis

questions.question: A 32-year-old woman presents with the finding as shown in the image. She gives history oftravel to South America and was bitten by a reduvid bug. Which of the following is the drug ofchoice for this condition?
questions.explanation: The scenario and the image showing Romaña sign point towards a diagnosis of Chagas disease(American trypanosomiasis) and the drug of choice in this condition is benznidazole.American trypanosomiasis is caused by Trypanosoma cruzi and can be managed by eitherbenznidazole or nifurtimox. Due to its favorable safety profile, benznidazole is considered thedrug of choice.Romaña sign is the unilateral painless periorbital swelling associated with the acute stage ofChagas disease.Albendazole and metronidazole are not indicated for American trypanosomiasis. Albendazole isused in infections with Ascaris lumbricoides, Trichuris trichiura and hookworms. Metronidazoleis used in the treatment of trichomoniasis and amebiasis.

questions.question: A patient presents in the late stage of West African sleeping sickness. What is the drug ofchoice in this condition?
questions.explanation: Nifurtimox in combination with eflornithine is the drug of choice for late-stage West Africansleeping sickness. It is caused by Trypanosoma brucei gambiense.Nifurtimox alone is indicated in American trypanosomiasis.537Melarsoprol is the drug of choice for late-stage East African (Rhodesian) trypanosomiasis. It is notindicated in combination with nifurtimox.

questions.question: Which of the following drugs can be used as first-line treatment in patients with early-stage ofEast African trypanosomiasis?
questions.explanation: Suramin is the first-line therapy for early-stage East African trypanosomiasis caused byTrypanosoma brucei rhodesiense.It is also active against Trypanosoma brucei gambiense but only indicated as a second-line agentwhen pentamidine fails or is contraindicated.Melarsoprol is the only effective drug available for the treatment of the late encephalopathic stageof East African sleeping sickness. It is caused by Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense. Melarsoprol iseffective in earlier stages also but is avoided because of its toxicity.

questions.question: The microscopy of fecal sample of a patient showed presence of Ascaris lumbricoides eggs.This condition can most effectively be treated with which of the following drugs?
questions.explanation: Roundworm infestation is most effectively treated with albendazole. It is considered as the drug ofchoice for the treatment of roundworm (Ascaris lumbricoides) infestation.Albendazole is considered as the drug of choice for treatment of infestation by:•Whipworm - Trichuris trichura causing trichuriasis• Hookworm - Ancylostoma duodenale•Roundworm - Ascaris lumbricoides• Dog tapeworm - Echinococcus granulosus causing hydatid diseaseAlbendazole is administered as a single oral 400-mg dose to adults and children more than 2years of age. Safety is not established for children less than 2 years. However, according to WHO,if the benefit outweighs the risk, albendazole at 200 mg can be given to children between the agesof 1-2years.

questions.question: What is the primary mechanism of action of benzimidazole?
questions.explanation: The primary mechanism of action of benzimidazoles is by inhibition of microtubulepolymerization. Benzimidazoles bind to beta-tubulin and cause inhibition of microtubulepolymerization.Drugs belonging to the benzimidazole group are:• Albendazole• Mebendazole•• Triclabendazole• Thiabendazole.538Mechanisms of action:• Inhibition of mitochondrial fumarate reductase• Reduced glucose transport•Uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation

questions.question: A young man working at a dairy farm presents with fever and abdominal pain. Examinationof his stool samples revealed the finding shown in the image. Which of the followingbenzimidazoles is indicated in this condition?528
questions.explanation: The given image showing operculated egg (egg having a lid-like structure on its end) is suggestiveof Fasciola hepatica and the benzimidazole indicated for infection with this organism istriclabendazole.

questions.question: The MRI of a patient who presented with new-onset seizures is shown below. What is thedrug of choice?
questions.explanation: The MRI findings (multiple cysticerci within the brain) are suggestive of neurocysticercosis andalbendazole is the drug of choice in this condition.Glucocorticoid therapy is usually begun before initiating albendazole and continued for severaldays after the commencement of therapy. It reduces the inflammatory reaction to the dead anddying cysticerci of Taenia solium.Note: Even though Albendazole and Praziquantel are used as a combination, the single bestanswer choice to this question is Albendazole.

questions.question: A 25-year-old man hospitalized with a hydatid cyst refused to undergo surgical removal of thecyst. He was treated with high dose albendazole for 3 months. This patient should bemonitored for toxicity to the:
questions.explanation: The patient described above should be monitored for toxicity to the liver. Liver dysfunction is oneof the common adverse effects of albendazole therapy and liver function tests should be routinelyconducted when long-term therapy is initiated.Long-term albendazole therapy is also associated with bone marrow toxicity. Therefore, bloodcounts should also be regularly monitored.

questions.question: What is the drug of choice in patients with onchocerciasis?
questions.explanation: Ivermectin is the drug of choice for onchocerciasis caused by Oncocerca volvulus in adults andchildren aged more than 5 years.Ivermectin is the drug of choice for:•Strongyloidiasis• Onchocerciasis539It is associated with Mazzotti reaction (fever, pruritic rash, lymphadenopathy) as a sideeffect when given for filariasis due to immune system activation by the dying parasite. Thisreaction is also seen with the use of diethylcarbamazine.

questions.question: A patient presents with itchy, serpiginous eruptions as shown in the image. He says that theselesions advance rapidly to different sites. What is the primary mechanism of action of thedrug preferred for this disease?530

options.A: Activation of glutamate gated chloride channels
options.B: Inhibition of glutamate gated chloride channels

questions.explanation: The clinical scenario and the image showing larva currens, points towards a diagnosis ofstrongyloidiasis, and the drug of choice in this condition is ivermectin. The mechanism of actionof ivermectin primarily involves activation of glutamate-gated chloride channels found only ininvertebrates.Ivermectin activates glutamate-activated chloride channels in the nerves and muscles of nematodeand results in the influx of chloride into the cell. This causes hyperpolarization of cells and resultsin paralysis of nematodes.

questions.question: What is the first-line treatment for a patient presenting with the finding shown below?
questions.explanation: The above image shows cutaneous larva migrans. Ivermectin is the first-line drug for thetreatment of cutaneous larva migrans.The first-line drugs used in cutaneous larva migrans include:•Ivermectin - 200µg/kg orally single dose• Albendazole 400mg orally for 3 days-

questions.question: A 17-year-old boy presents with painless hematuria. He has a history of travel to Kenya. Urinemicroscopy revealed the finding shown below. What is the drug of choice in this condition?
questions.explanation: The clinical scenario and the image showing the egg of Schistosoma hematobium (egg withterminal spine), point towards the diagnosis of schistosomiasis. Praziquantel is the drug of choicefor schistosomiasis caused by all Schistosoma species that can infect humans.A single oral dose of 40 mg/kg or three doses of 20 mg/kg each, given 4-6 h apart, generallyproduce cure rates of 70%-95% and consistently high reductions (>85%) in egg counts.

questions.question: Which of the following drugs causes flaccid paralysis of Ascaris lumbricoides?
questions.explanation: Piperazine causes flaccid paralysis of Ascaris lumbricoides.It acts as a GABA receptor agonist and increases chloride ion conductance across the Ascarismuscle membrane. This results in hyperpolarisation and reduced excitability, which leads tomuscle relaxation and flaccid paralysis.Metrifonate, levamisole and tribendimidine are anthelminthic drugs that cause spastic paralysis.540

questions.question: 532Diethylcarbamazine is used for the treatment of:
questions.explanation: Diethylcarbamazine (DEC) is used for the control and treatment of lymphatic filariasis caused byW. bancrofti, B. malayi and B. timori.Other indications for the use of DEC are:⚫ Loiasis• Tropical pulmonary eosinophilia

questions.question: A patient presents with fever, fatigue, and malaise. Investigations reveal anemia andthrombocytopenia. Thin blood smear is shown below. What is the recommended therapy forthis condition?
questions.explanation: The given scenario and the microscopic image showing tetrads or Maltese cross, point towards adiagnosis of babesiosis and the recommended therapy for this condition is azithromycin plusatovaquone.Babesiosis is a zoonotic infection that resembles malaria. It presents with febrile illness, hemolysisand hemoglobinuria.For mild or moderate disease: Azithromycin plus atovaquone.For severe disease:• Recommended regimen - azithromycin plus atovaquone.•Alternative regimen - clindamycin plus quinine.Severe babesiosis typically occurs in patients with one or more of the following characteristics: age>50 years, neonatal prematurity, asplenia/hyposplenism, HIV/AIDS, malignancy, andimmunosuppressive therapy.

questions.question: A patient presented with fever and cervical lymphadenopathy. Investigations revealed IgMtoxoplasma antibodies. Which of the following agents is most effective in treating thiscondition?
questions.explanation: Pyrimethamine is the most effective agent against toxoplasmosis and is present in most of theregimens. It is combined with sulfadiazine or clindamycin for toxoplasmosis.Trimethoprim plus sulfamethoxazole (cotrimoxazole) is an alternative.541
